name: app_packageGET
description: Queries the information related to individual application package resources

appPkgId.description: Identifier of an individual application package resource

$block: 'The data type AppPkgInfo represents the parameters for an application package resource'

$ul: **_links**: Links to resources related to this resource.
**appD**
**href**: URI referring to a resource
**appPkgContent**
**href**: URI referring to a resource
**self**
**href**: URI referring to a resource
**additionalArtifacts**: Additional information of application package artifacts that are not application software images. Type is TBD
**appDId**: Identifier of this MEC application descriptor. This attribute shall be globally unique.
**appDVersion**: Identifies the version of the application descriptor.
**appName**: Name to identify the MEC application.
**appProvider**: Provider of the application and of the AppD.
**appSoftwareVersion**: Software version of the application. This is updated when there is any change to the software in the onboarded application package.
**checksum**:
**algorithm**:  Name of the algorithm used to generate the checksum,  as defined in ETSI GS NFV-SOL 004. For example, SHA-256, SHA-512.
**hash**: 'String 1 The hexadecimal value of the checksum'
**id**: Identifier of the onboarded application package.
**onboardingState**: Onboarding state of application package

**operationalState**: Operational state of the onboarded application package: Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ENABLED: the application package can be used for instantiation of new application instances. Ã¢â‚¬Â¢DISABLED: the application package cannot be used for further application instantiation requests.
**softwareImages**: Information of application software image in application package. Type is TBD
**usageState**: Usage state of the onboarded instance of the application package

**userDefinedData**: 'This data type represents a list of key-value pairs. The order of the pairs in the list is not significant. In JSON, a set of key-value pairs is represented as an object. It shall comply with the provisions defined in clause 4 of IETF RFC 8259'

**instance**: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem

**title**: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type
